Definition of low-risk prostate cancer: prostate specific antigen (PSA) ≤10 ng/mL, Gleason score ≤6, clinical stage ≤ T2a)

1) men should have a histologically proven adenocarcinoma of the prostate, and they should be fit for possible curative treatment, be willing to attend the follow-up visits, and should not have received former therapy [                         2                        ]; clinical stage T1c/T2 [                         3                        ]; GS ≤ 6 [                         4                        ]; ≤ 2 positive biopsy cores [                         5                        ]; PSA ≤ 10 ng/mL [                         6                        ]; PSAD ≤ 0.2 ng/mL/ml.
≤cT2c, ≤2 cores with proven cancer,                        Gleason score ≤6 (3 + 3), prostate specific antigen (PSA) density <0.2 ng/mL2 and PSA <10 ng/mL.
